description:
Crashes on login in Fedora 31 KDE spin, cannot set wallpaper and some shortcuts don't execute. This widget will disappear when I click my real KDE desktop and there is no notification icon in system tray or anything to get this back, have to open this app/widget again from programs menu (it's not available in the widgets menu as well).

One pro feature here is that apps changing resolutions won't change the icon layout here - tried only once and they stayed. Whereas icons on the regular desktop will get messed up.
app works fine on recommended distributions, just not on fedora
summary: get the fedora integration fixed would be epic

summary: Looks promising but is useless for now

description:
Gnome is my DE of choice because of it's simplicity... It doesn't do much and I don't need it to. One of the major shortcomings of Gnome to my mind has always been desktop functionality. Even before icons were removed from stock Gnome, I found them buggy and annoying.

This changes that, adding proper support for desktop icons to new versions of Gnome, and making it easy to organise my hectic workflow using panels and notes.
when i try to star an app, it just drags it. doesnt matter how fast i touch the icon. if i touch it really fast,the icon just jumps to another place lol
Functionalities are unique and awesome, but needs some stability.. It crashes sometimes on Fedora 32..

Features are unique and awesome.... Just rare crashes....
There is no way to hide file names.... I use 'Desktop Folder' along with 'Add-to-desktop' extension.... I keep my apps on desktop so I don't need names.... Please do hide the names....
Desktop was overlaid by an invisible window, icons on the dessktop, nor right-click menu were accesible.

Where's My Trash and Home Folder link? Also enqueue in media player opens the new file instead of putting it in cue. If these things worked I'd give it a 5 star rating. Since the only thing it does right is sort by name, date, or type, I give it 2.
summary: Where's My Trash and Home Folder link?

description: I can't see my wallpaper or the shortcuts on my desktop. Now way to close it except restarting computer with it disabled from startup
summary: Covers the screen in a black box

description:
This has problems with the KDE Plasma desktop. You should state that so that users
do not damage their KDE desktop settings.
Makes the system stops do not install it malware
When it runs, it covers the entire desktop with a black box. No controls or window decorations or any other way I can see to change it. System monitor. Desktopfolder. kill Kill KILL!
summary: If you want an empty black desktop, this app is for you!

description: Can't set wallpaper which sucks, but has other cool features

ubuntu 20.04 LTS 
full bug

It doesn't show trash home etc. icons (the main reason for installing it).
I can't change or view wallpapers, just a black background.

I had a similar issue after installing the program and then rebooting my system. I was a bit shocked to see nothing but a black background and no means to figure out how to change it.

When I right-clicked on the blank background, I was presented with a menu to add or change a few things, but the desktop background could not be added/changed.

I tried making a group and it seemed to do it, but within a few minutes the screen went kind of "wonky" and then my usual wallpaper showed up. I suspect the app had crashed.

I'm somewhat disappointed with the results since I had something very similar back in the days I was using Windows. I like to have my desktop icons nicely grouped (some people complained that it's too much like the days of Win3.1, but I don't agree).

Thus, I will have to remove this app before it possibly corrupts something. I would like to see this program developed and properly tested. I am using Linux Lite 5.8. If the developers can get around to upgrading this application, I would be more than happy to try it again in the future.
once again know joy
no package message, when trying to remove,
summary: not what i wanted, and it cant be removed??

Die Bedienung ist recht unintuitiv, aber mit etwas reinfuchsen durchaus machbar; Stürzt leider permanent ab, und ist somit für mich aktuell nicht nutzbar.

description: Funktioniert ideal für Ubuntu 22.04.1 da es dort keinen klassischen Desktop gibt. Nicht wundern wenn beim doppelklick mit der Maus die Icons verschwinden, dass ist nur eine einstellungssache des Programms.
Funktioniert bei mir (amd64, Debian 11) nicht, keine wirklichen Desktop-Verknüpfungen, überdeckt den Desktop, Anwendungen hängen.
Öffnet, macht aber nicht mehr. Wer ein Programm braucht, das einfach nur läuft, der ist hier richtig!

las capetas del escritorio,no deja colocar foto de escritorio

Funciona un rato y luego bloquea todo lo que estas haciendo. Solo queda la opción de reinicio, con riesgo de perder algo que no llegaste a guardar. Terminé desinstalandola

Retrouver ses fichiers, dossiers sur le bureau est un vrai bonheur et les petits plus (photos, notes...) sont vraiment appréciables.

Malheureusement impossible d'avoir un fond d'écran avec cette version (1.1.2) : j'obtiens un fond gris uni.
Visiblement il y avait un bug similaire (fond noir) sous Fedora et la version 1.1.3 règle le problème, je n'ai pas testé.
